publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4132 John Wilson: Smart Metering Fuel Poverty—That the Parliament welcomes the UK Government’s commitment to provide for the installation of smart meters in every home throughout the United Kingdom by 2020 and notes also that the introduction of smart meters will assist every household in reducing energy usage by up to 2-3%, which amounts to an annual saving of over £20 and thus making a meaningful contribution for people in fuel poverty. Supported by: Jim Tolson*, Hugh Henry*, Brian Adam*, Bob Doris*, Kenneth Gibson*, Jackie Baillie*, Stuart McMillan*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Joe FitzPatrick*
S3M-4132 Smart Metering Fuel Poverty (lodged on 13 May 2009) Bill Kidd*
